text: The Id family of helix-loop-helix proteins function as negative regulators of DNA binding , basic helix-loop-helix proteins in the regulation of cell growth and differentiation .

We report here on the identification of a 17 kDa variant of the 14 kDa <extra_id_0> Id-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein termed Id-3L ( long version ) which possesses a unique 60 amino acid carboxy-terminus generated by read through of a 'coding intron ' and alternative splicing .

Northern analysis revealed expression of a minor 1.1 kb Id-3L transcript together with the predominant 0.95 kb <extra_id_0> Id-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcript in the majority of adult human tissues analysed .

The variant Id-3L protein is functionally distinguishable from conventional <extra_id_0> Id-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> since in in vitro DNA mobility shift assays , it was greatly impaired in its ability to abrogate binding of the basic helix-loop-helix protein , <extra_id_0> E47 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , to an E box recognition sequence .
